We Are Powerful Because We Are Many (nonprofitquarterly.org)

profileSummary: executive leader, impact investor, and creative entrepreneur
profileContent: She currently serves as Co-CEO at Common Future, an organization which invests in Black and indigenous communities so that racial economic inequality becomes a thing of the past. Her expertise lies in brand strategy and positioning, grant and capital raising, storytelling and influenceâ€”all in service to building a more equitable economy.
With A Space Unfolds, she and her wife are building a design practice that centers healthy materials, sustainable sourcing, and non-extractive labor practices in building house and home.

On her Substack, she brings her expertise in exploring what regenerating the climate and repairing inequity means for everyday people, including the actions we can all take towards a more equitable economic future.
Jess is a former columnist at Forbes and has spoken at convening of the Skoll World Forum, the Aspen Institute, Nonprofit Quarterly, and Stanford Social Innovation Review.
